info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 1:46PM EDT until July 10 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Vermont, including the following county, Lamoille.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.25 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morrisville, Morristown, Stowe, Morrisville Village, Hyde Park Village, Johnson, Hyde Park, Cambridge, Cadys Falls, Moscow and Smugglers Notch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
